# This Python 3 environment comes with many helpful analytics libraries installed
# It is defined by the kaggle/python Docker image: https://github.com/kaggle/docker-python
# For example, here's several helpful packages to load

import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

# You can write up to 20GB to the current directory (/kaggle/working/) that gets preserved as output when you create a version using "Save & Run All" 
# You can also write temporary files to /kaggle/temp/, but they won't be saved outside of the current session
source.bdde3b88:
# Read in the submission files of the well performing notebooks
subcb = pd.read_csv('../input/tps-08-21-catboost/submission.csv')
subxgb = pd.read_csv('../input/tps-08-21-xgboost/submission.csv')
sublgbm = pd.read_csv('../input/tps-lgbm-model/submission.csv')
subtemplate = pd.read_csv('../input/tabular-playground-series-aug-2021/sample_submission.csv')
source.b3e28e4b:
# Add the values of the losses from the three notebooks and average them out
subloss = (subcb['loss'] + subxgb['loss'] + sublgbm['loss'])/3
subloss
source.203227ff:
# Create your submission dataframe
subtemplate['loss'] = subloss
subtemplate
source.b2245efd:
# Convert the dataframe into a csv for submission
subtemplate.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
source.a35932cd:
This notebook is for anyone who wants to understand and submit a decent notebook for TPS August in less than 5 minutes

TLDR: Get predictions from good notebooks (LGBM, CatBoost, XGBoost) and average them. Submit them.
